text: We declare to you what was from the beginning, what we have heard, what we have seen with our eyes, what we have looked at and touched with our hands, concerning the word of life—
speaker: Narrator

text: this life was revealed, and we have seen it and testify to it and declare to you the eternal life that was with the Father and was revealed to us—
speaker: Narrator

text: what we have seen and heard we also declare to you so that you also may have fellowship with us, and truly our fellowship is with the Father and with his Son Jesus Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: We are writing these things so that our joy may be complete.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the message we have heard from him and proclaim to you, that God is light and in him there is no darkness at all.
speaker: Narrator

text: If we say that we have fellowship with him while we are walking in darkness, we lie and do not do what is true;
speaker: Narrator

text: but if we walk in the light as he himself is in the light, we have fellowship with one another, and the blood of Jesus his Son cleanses us from all sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: If we say that we have no sin, we deceive ourselves, and the truth is not in us.
speaker: Narrator

text: If we confess our sins, he who is faithful and just will forgive us our sins and cleanse us from all unrighteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: If we say that we have not sinned, we make him a liar, and his word is not in us.
speaker: Narrator

text: My little children, I am writing these things to you so that you may not sin. But if anyone does sin, we have an advocate with the Father, Jesus Christ the righteous,
speaker: Narrator

text: and he is the atoning sacrifice for our sins, and not for ours only but also for the sins of the whole world.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now by this we know that we have come to know him, if we obey his commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever says, “I have come to know him,” but does not obey his commandments is a liar, and in such a person the truth does not exist;
speaker: Narrator

text: but whoever obeys his word, truly in this person the love of God has reached perfection. By this we know that we are in him:
speaker: Narrator

text: whoever says, “I abide in him,” ought to walk in the same way as he walked.
speaker: Narrator

text: Beloved, I am writing you no new commandment but an old commandment that you have had from the beginning; the old commandment is the word that you have heard.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet I am writing you a new commandment that is true in him and in you, because the darkness is passing away and the true light is already shining.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever says, “I am in the light,” while hating a brother or sister, is still in the darkness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever loves a brother or sister abides in the light, and in such a person there is no cause for stumbling.
speaker: Narrator

text: But whoever hates a brother or sister is in the darkness, walks in the darkness, and does not know the way to go, because the darkness has brought on blindness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am writing to you, little children,
    because your sins are forgiven on account of his name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am writing to you, fathers,
    because you know him who is from the beginning.
I am writing to you, young people,
    because you have conquered the evil one.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I write to you, children,
    because you know the Father.
I write to you, fathers,
    because you know him who is from the beginning.
I write to you, young people,
    because you are strong
    and the word of God abides in you,
        and you have overcome the evil one.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not love the world or the things in the world. The love of the Father is not in those who love the world,
speaker: Narrator

text: for all that is in the world—the desire of the flesh, the desire of the eyes, the pride in riches—comes not from the Father but from the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the world and its desire are passing away, but those who do the will of God abide forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Children, it is the last hour! As you have heard that antichrist is coming, so now many antichrists have come. From this we know that it is the last hour.
speaker: Narrator

text: They went out from us, but they did not belong to us, for if they had belonged to us they would have remained with us. But by going out they made it plain that none of them belongs to us.
speaker: Narrator

text: But you have been anointed by the Holy One, and all of you have knowledge.
speaker: Narrator

text: I write to you, not because you do not know the truth, but because you know it, and you know that no lie comes from the truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who is the liar but the one who denies that Jesus is the Christ? This is the antichrist, the one who denies the Father and the Son.
speaker: Narrator

text: No one who denies the Son has the Father; everyone who confesses the Son has the Father also.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let what you heard from the beginning abide in you. If what you heard from the beginning abides in you, then you will abide in the Son and in the Father.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this is what he has promised us, eternal life.
speaker: Narrator

text: I write these things to you concerning those who would deceive you.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for you, the anointing that you received from him abides in you, so you do not need anyone to teach you. But as his anointing teaches you about all things and is true and is not a lie, and just as it has taught you, abide in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now, little children, abide in him, so that when he is revealed we may have confidence and not be put to shame before him at his coming.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you perceive that he is righteous, you also know that everyone who does right has been born of him.
speaker: Narrator

text: See what love the Father has given us, that we should be called children of God, and that is what we are. The reason the world does not know us is that it did not know him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Beloved, we are God’s children now; what we will be has not yet been revealed. What we do know is this: when he is revealed, we will be like him, for we will see him as he is.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all who have this hope in him purify themselves, just as he is pure.
speaker: Narrator

text: Everyone who commits sin is guilty of lawlessness; sin is lawlessness.
speaker: Narrator

text: You know that he was revealed to take away sins, and in him there is no sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: No one who abides in him sins; no one who sins has either seen him or known him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Little children, let no one deceive you. Everyone who does what is right is righteous, just as he is righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text: Everyone who commits sin is of the devil, for the devil has been sinning from the beginning. The Son of God was revealed for this purpose: to destroy the works of the devil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who have been born of God do not sin because God’s seed abides in them; they cannot sin because they have been born of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: The children of God and the children of the devil are revealed in this way: all who do not do what is right are not from God, nor are those who do not love a brother or sister.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this is the message you have heard from the beginning, that we should love one another.
speaker: Narrator

text: We must not be like Cain, who was from the evil one and murdered his brother. And why did he murder him? Because his own deeds were evil and his brother’s righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not be astonished, brothers and sisters, that the world hates you.
speaker: Narrator

text: We know that we have passed from death to life because we love the brothers and sisters. Whoever does not love abides in death.
speaker: Narrator

text: All who hate a brother or sister are murderers, and you know that murderers do not have eternal life abiding in them.
speaker: Narrator

text: We know love by this, that he laid down his life for us—and we ought to lay down our lives for the brothers and sisters.
speaker: Narrator

text: How does God’s love abide in anyone who has the world’s goods and sees a brother or sister in need and yet refuses help?
speaker: Narrator

text: Little children, let us love not in word or speech but in deed and truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And by this we will know that we are from the truth and will reassure our hearts before him
speaker: Narrator

text: whenever our hearts condemn us, for God is greater than our hearts, and he knows everything.
speaker: Narrator

text: Beloved, if our hearts do not condemn us, we have boldness before God,
speaker: Narrator

text: and we receive from him whatever we ask, because we obey his commandments and do what pleases him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this is his commandment, that we should believe in the name of his Son Jesus Christ and love one another, just as he has commanded us.
speaker: Narrator

text: All who obey his commandments abide in him, and he abides in them. And by this we know that he abides in us, by the Spirit that he has given us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Beloved, do not believe every spirit, but test the spirits to see whether they are from God, for many false prophets have gone out into the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: By this you know the Spirit of God: every spirit that confesses that Jesus Christ has come in the flesh is from God,
speaker: Narrator

text: and every spirit that does not confess Jesus is not from God. And this is the spirit of the antichrist, of which you have heard that it is coming, and now it is already in the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: Little children, you are from God and have conquered them, for the one who is in you is greater than the one who is in the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are from the world; therefore what they say is from the world, and the world listens to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: We are from God. Whoever knows God listens to us, and whoever is not from God does not listen to us. From this we know the spirit of truth and the spirit of error.
speaker: Narrator

text: Beloved, let us love one another, because love is from God; everyone who loves is born of God and knows God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever does not love does not know God, for God is love.
speaker: Narrator

text: God’s love was revealed among us in this way: God sent his only Son into the world so that we might live through him.
speaker: Narrator

text: In this is love, not that we loved God but that he loved us and sent his Son to be the atoning sacrifice for our sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: Beloved, since God loved us so much, we also ought to love one another.
speaker: Narrator

text: No one has ever seen God; if we love one another, God abides in us, and his love is perfected in us.
speaker: Narrator

text: By this we know that we abide in him and he in us, because he has given us of his Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: And we have seen and do testify that the Father has sent his Son as the Savior of the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: God abides in those who confess that Jesus is the Son of God, and they abide in God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So we have known and believe the love that God has for us.
God is love, and those who abide in love abide in God, and God abides in them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Love has been perfected among us in this: that we may have boldness on the day of judgment, because as he is, so are we in this world.
speaker: Narrator

text: There is no fear in love, but perfect love casts out fear; for fear has to do with punishment, and whoever fears has not reached perfection in love.
speaker: Narrator

text: We love because he first loved us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who say, “I love God,” and hate a brother or sister are liars, for those who do not love a brother or sister, whom they have seen, cannot love God, whom they have not seen.
speaker: Narrator

text: The commandment we have from him is this: those who love God must love their brothers and sisters also.
speaker: Narrator

text: Everyone who believes that Jesus is the Christ has been born of God, and everyone who loves the parent loves the child.
speaker: Narrator

text: By this we know that we love the children of God, when we love God and obey his commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the love of God is this, that we obey his commandments. And his commandments are not burdensome,
speaker: Narrator

text: for whatever is born of God conquers the world. And this is the victory that conquers the world, our faith.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who is it who conquers the world but the one who believes that Jesus is the Son of God?
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the one who came by water and blood, Jesus Christ, not with the water only but with the water and the blood. And the Spirit is the one that testifies, for the Spirit is the truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: There are three that testify:
speaker: Narrator

text: the Spirit and the water and the blood, and these three agree.
speaker: Narrator

text: If we receive human testimony, the testimony of God is greater, for this is the testimony of God that he has testified to his Son.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who believe in the Son of God have the testimony in their hearts. Those who do not believe in God have made him a liar by not believing in the testimony that God has given concerning his Son.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this is the testimony: God gave us eternal life, and this life is in his Son.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever has the Son has life; whoever does not have the Son of God does not have life.
speaker: Narrator

text: I write these things to you who believe in the name of the Son of God, so that you may know that you have eternal life.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this is the boldness we have in him, that if we ask anything according to his will, he hears us.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if we know that he hears us in whatever we ask, we know that we have obtained the requests made of him.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you see your brother or sister committing what is not a deadly sin, you will ask, and God will give life to such a one—to those whose sin is not deadly. There is sin that is deadly; I do not say that you should pray about that.
speaker: Narrator

text: All wrongdoing is sin, but there is sin that is not deadly.
speaker: Narrator

text: We know that those who are born of God do not sin, but the one who was born of God protects them, and the evil one does not touch them.
speaker: Narrator

text: We know that we are God’s children and that the whole world lies under the power of the evil one.
speaker: Narrator

text: And we know that the Son of God has come and has given us understanding so that we may know him who is true; and we are in him who is true, in his Son Jesus Christ. He is the true God and eternal life.
speaker: Narrator

text: Little children, keep yourselves from idols.
speaker: Narrator
